title: Extended San-serif Typeface
content:
Hi all,

I am interested to know if anyone can identify this typeface? It should be quite easy, I just cannot seem to find it online anywhere. I'm sure this will be an easy one…

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102736im_/http:/typophile.com/files/iso50-g-giveaway-101_4174.jpg)

Also, I've not used extended fonts ever, and wondered what are a few good ones to use? More importantly, are there any good ones stored away in my default typefaces somewhere (I'm a Mac user with CS3). Any help you could give would be very much appreciated.

Many thanks,

Nat
author: The White Lion

comments.content: Looks like Akzidenz-Grotesk Extended to me. Other good/similar ones: Helvetica Extended and Univers 53, 63, 73, 93 (both a bit obvious, I expect someone else will suggest more interesting examples).

Hmm… Akzidenz-Grotesk Extended is almost there. Unfortunately the terminal of the G doesn't quite lie parallel to the crossbar, like it looks like it does in this example. It is quite small though, so maybe it is.

Being a poor graduate, I have been buying Univers in stages as I've got the money, so I only have 6 fonts so far (not got as far as the Extended fonts!)

Helvetica could be a good one though.

Thanks,

Nat
I do love/hate being an anal perfectionist.
Similar: Sackers Gothic or Engravers Gothic …

Oh gawd, I love that little ghost. Is it a dingbat? :-)  
(Yes, I know it'd be easy to draw.)

Nope (unfortunately - I love it too!) It is a logo for a record company:

[http://ghostly.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102736/http:/ghostly.com/ "http://ghostly.com/")

Here it is being used by ISO50/Tycho for an anniversary poster design:

[http://blog.iso50.com/2009/09/08/tycho-live-924-seattle/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102736/http:/blog.iso50.com/2009/09/08/tycho-live-924-seattle/ "http://blog.iso50.com/2009/09/08/tycho-live-924-seattle/")  
 [http://blog.iso50.com/2009/08/19/ghostly-tycho-chicago-giveaway/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102736/http:/blog.iso50.com/2009/08/19/ghostly-tycho-chicago-giveaway/ "http://blog.iso50.com/2009/08/19/ghostly-tycho-chicago-giveaway/")  
 [http://blog.iso50.com/2009/08/17/tycho-iso50-live-in-chicago-frida/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102736/http:/blog.iso50.com/2009/08/17/tycho-iso50-live-in-chicago-frida/ "http://blog.iso50.com/2009/08/17/tycho-iso50-live-in-chicago-frida/")

He uses different shade ghosts to make a number/character (first one being an 'X' and the last being the number '10')

Many thanks to all for the replies. I will investigate them all!

Nat

Wow, that's great stuff!\* Thanks for sharing.  
(\* Except maybe that evil typo in the sample you posted… ;-) )

BTW, Zeppelin is also nice and wide:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/zeppelin/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102736/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/zeppelin/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/zeppelin/")
Hmm, missed the evil typo! Not like me… (where is it?)
Wow, that is nice. Especially the Extended Bold weight! Thanks.

_missed the evil typo!_

Gho **sl** ty 10 years …
Ouch! That's a bad one… good eye! (glad I didn't design it - would have annoyed me so much!)

Isn't that sans Titling Gothic from Font Bureau. [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/TitlingGothicFB/charset](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102736/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/TitlingGothicFB/charset "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/TitlingGothicFB/charset")

Several times Scott mentioned it using it.  
\_

Sandro

Oh cool, thanks Ravel/Sandro!

I'll check it out when I'm home.

bert\_vanderveen: Yes, quite PacMan-ish.

Nat
